classification.panel_rating_context: For panels up to 200 amps (datasheet positioning)

overview.short: Secondary level surge protection for IEEE Category B sub-panels up to 200 amps.
overview.long: The SurgePure Mach 1 SPD System provides secondary level, multi-element surge protection for electrical sub-distribution panels. Designed for IEEE Category B locations, it isolates sensitive downstream equipment from nearby switching motor loads and in-house surges when installed downstream from primary level protection, helping preserve assets and support long-term system reliability.

positioning_headlines: For IEEE Category B Sub-Panels / Secondary Locations
Basic Secondary Level Protection For Panels Up To 200 Amps
When Downline from Primary Level Protection
marketing_paragraphs: It isolates your sensitive downline equipment from nearby switching motor loads and in-house surges to compliment your upline grid of non-degrading SurgePures. It preserves your assets and maximizes your long-term profits!
The Mach 1 SPD System is secondary level of multi-element surge protection to be located at your sub-distribution Panels.

key_features: Safe 240,000 amps of multi-element surge capacity for secondary level protection.
Unique fuse-links maintain safety of nearby equipment during catastrophic failure.
Designed for easy mounting and installation for 'close-coupled' surge protection.
Provides reliable, cost-effective component level isolation as part of protection grid.
Integral grid of primary and secondary levels of non-degrading SPD technology provides long-term 24/7 AC power system integrity.

safety_ratings_and_claims.type_rating_claim: Safety rated as SPD Type 1 & Type 2
additional_claims: Mach 1 provides reliable secondary level protection when downline from primary level SurgePures.

safety_and_compliance.overcurrent_protection: Type 2 only, use 15 amp breaker – CODE RULE 26-420

status_indicators.description: Lifetime green LED self-test protection status monitors for each phase

provenance.mpn_column_binding: This product JSON binds to the M1-1240-4 column in the Mach 1 spec table. Marketing/context text is shared across the Mach 1 datasheet and stored under document_context.
extraction_notes: Use document_context + key_features + safety_ratings_and_claims for downstream synthesis and copy generation.
Use electrical_specs/mechanical_specs/safety_and_compliance for normalization and spec tables.
